picks.title: A Gambler's Anatomy
picks.author: Jonathan Lethem
picks.text: A fun, genre-bending read. An aging, competitive backgammon player is diagnosed with a life-threatening tumor and, upon it's removal, becomes convinced that he has psychic powers. The real star of this novel though is the game of backgammon, which I've never had any interest in until I read this book. I still have no idea how to play the game, but Lethem makes it seem like a heck of a good time.
picks.name: Benjamin Sapadin

picks.title: Across the Nightingale Floor
picks.author: Lian Hearn
picks.text: A masterpiece of understated prose, subtle magic and deep character building. The first in the Tales of the Otori series, it follows Tomasu's journey from a village of religious outcasts to becoming Takeo, adopted son of Lord Otori Shigeru. He must confront mysteries of his past, including his blood ties to the inscrutable Tribe, a band of assassins and spies who profit from keeping the realm in chaos.
picks.name: Joshua Soule

picks.title: Agorafabulous: Dispatches From My Bedroom
picks.author: Sara Benincasa
picks.text: The comedienne shares tales from her anxiety-filled life in a way that makes everything near-tragic that can come your way seem funny, universally relatable and ultimately handle-able.
picks.name: Jill Rothstein

picks.title: American Heiress: The Wild Saga of the Kidnapping, Crimes and Trial of Patty Hearst
picks.author: Jeffrey Toobin
picks.text: For all my fellow true crime lovers.  It is a bonkers story and Toobin skillfully arranges his research so that it reads like a novel.  Just like Serial the Podcast and Making a Murderer, you will want to talk about it with everyone you run into.
picks.name: Laura Stein

picks.title: Atomic Robo: The Everything Explodes Collection
picks.author: Brian Clevinger and Scott Wegener
picks.text: This three-volume collection follows the adventures of Robo as he fights evil villains bent on world domination. Perfect for fans of Indiana Jones, alternate histories, and sassy robots.
picks.name: Crystal Chen

picks.title: Chasing the Scream: The First & Last Days of the War on Drugs
picks.author: Johann Hari
picks.text: An extensively researched, in-depth look at drugs, the "war" thereon, and what that war has done to our country -- and what different methods other countries have occasionally been able to employ. The analysis of how and why the war started (not least the purposeful racism behind it) and the damage that it has caused is extremely sobering, but there is also a glimmer of hope as we begin to understand what addiction really means and what our alternatives are. Get ready to question some very basic assumptions.
picks.name: Kay Menick

picks.title: Dark Money: The Hidden History of the Billionaires Behind the Rise of the Radical Right
picks.author: Jane Mayer
picks.text: Mayer reveals the paranoid ultra-right moves and mental machinations of the Koch brothers and friendsâwith stuff like this, conspiracy theories seem to lack excitement and imagination.
picks.name: Andrew Fairweather

picks.title: Dinner with Edward
picks.author: Isabel Vincent
picks.text: A lovely reflection on the unexpected friendship she forged with a friend's 93 year old father. Over meals Edward cooks with care and thoughtfulness, they examine love and life and savor it all.
picks.name: Maura Muller

picks.title: Dog Shaming
picks.author: Pascale Lemire
picks.text: Convinced that your dog is the strangest canine that ever lived? Well, you're not alone. You'll be cracking up at photographic proof that all dogs are bound to be hilariously weird.
picks.name: Kathleen Fais

picks.title: Eastern Europe! : Everything You Need to Know About The History (And More!) Of A Region That Shaped Our World and Still Does
picks.author: Tomek Jankowski
picks.text: As long as it sounds but much more readable. For fans of epic fantasy, this is the real thing and just as much drama.
picks.name: Margaret Siggillino

picks.title: Embassytown
picks.author: China Mieville
picks.text: An alien species incapable of lies slowly learns the art from their human compatriots, only to discover that it is addictively intoxicating.
picks.name: Alessandra Affinito

picks.title: How to Set a Fire and Why
picks.author: Jesse Ball
picks.text: Living in the mind of Lucia is a pleasure; her circumstances on the other hand are not so pleasant. She lives in a garage with her aunt, her father is dead, and her mother in a mental institution. She is a razor sharp, darkly funny, clever adolescent with a manifesto about arson being a cleansing force against a ruling class and a âsystem that demoralizes and brutalizes the majority of living people.â
picks.name: Lynn Lobash

picks.title: In the Wake
picks.author: Per Petterson
picks.text: Confronting grief and mourning six years after a major tragedy in his life, we find a companion who understands our own sorrows. The writing soothes, while the story develops gradually through memory and the landscape.
picks.name: Jessica Cline

picks.title: It Ends With Us
picks.author: Colleen Hoover
picks.text: This book elicits every emotion you can imagine. It is thought provoking, empowering, will break your heart and stay with you long after you finish.
picks.name: Morgan O'Reilly

picks.title: Lazarus
picks.author: Greg Rucka and Michael Lark
picks.text: Set in a feudalistic future where 16 wealthy families rule the world, a young woman with regenerative powers must come to grips with who she is and her role as protector of the corrupt family Carlyle.
picks.name: Crystal Chen

picks.title: Mao II
picks.author: Don Delillo
picks.text: Mao II is by far my favorite Don Delillo novel, and a really topical read in light of the current social and political climate. Set in New York in the 1990s, the twists and turns in Mao II highlight some salient points about the news media, terrorism, religion, art, and the madness of crowds that are still relevant 30 years later.
picks.name: Nancy Aravecz

picks.title: Mister Monkey
picks.author: Francine Prose
picks.text: A snarky book with an absurd premise, biting wit, sharp social observations, and just the right dose of sweetness to keep it from being downright cruel.
picks.name: Nancy Aravecz

picks.title: Neurotribes: The Legacy and Future of Neurodiversity
picks.author: Steve Silberman
picks.text: A science book that kept this fiction reader compelled from beginning to end. An epic history of autism and a true page turner, from deplorable early treatment in institutions to the intrigue and politics of 20th century scientists, the persistence of parents and ultimately the celebration of neuro differences as part of our species. Honestly, I couldn't put this down.
picks.name: Danita Nichols

picks.title: News of the World
picks.author: Paulette Jiles
picks.text: Jefferson Kyle Kidd is makes a living reading the news to the townsfolk in 1870s Texas. Kidd has been charged with returning Joanna, a Native American captive, to her family. The characters' voices are so distinctive it is hard to imagine they came from the same author. Both are complex and memorable.
picks.name: Lynn Lobash

picks.title: Nicotine
picks.author: Nell Zink
picks.text: Following the death of her Shaman father, Penny soon finds herself living in a community of anarchist activist squatters in Jersey City. Her adopted family is not short on eccentrics, but maybe more healthy than the cobbled together one she had before. Offbeat, quirky and full of fresh sharp metaphors and observations.
picks.name: Lynn Lobash

picks.title: Nuts
picks.author: Alice Clayton
picks.text: Smart, hilarious, full of good food and fabulous innuendos, this romance novel takes place in the Hudson Valley, featuring a personal chef home for the summer, and the gorgeous, sexy, and passionate farmer. First encounter? He brings her nuts, and in a turn worthy of a screwball comedy, they wind up on top of each other in the middle of the diner kitchen. It got better from there - and I've been texting all my friends telling them they need to read this book.
picks.name: Kathleen Fais

picks.title: One Child: The Story of China's Most Radical Experiment
picks.author: Mei Fong
picks.text: Longform journalism that reads like a novel. Fong, a veteran reporter, explores China's one-child policy nearly 40 years after it was established, at the beginning of its phase-out in 2015. Fong also writes about her own attempts to have a child, and her blend of personal story, sociology, history, and on-the-ground reporting creates a total page-turner.
picks.name: Gwen Glazer

picks.title: Orphans of the Carnival
picks.author: Carol Birch
picks.text: "In the Hall of Ugliness the competition was stiff. But no one had ever seen anything quite like Julia . . ." But Julia Pastrana stood apart from the other carnival acts. This fictionalized account of the real person shows her beautiful inner life and quest for a quiet home in the countryside.
picks.name: Jenny Baum

picks.title: Sleeping on Jupiter
picks.author: Anurada Roy
picks.text: A group of disparate characters gather in a spiritual seaside town in India. All the characters are harboring secrets and seeking answers. The story is told from multiple perspectives and plotlines are woven together in an open-ended manner. The characters storylines expose some duplicitous aspects of Indian culture.
picks.name: Lynn Lobash

picks.title: Slow Days, Fast Company: The World, the Flesh, and L.A.
picks.author: Eve Babitz
picks.text: A breezy, quick blast of fictional memoir that evokes a Los Angeles that feels both familiar yet completely different from today's version. Babitz's characters spend relaxed days and seductive nights drinking, drugging and generally lounging their way through life in Hollywood, Palm Springs and other classic Southern California locales. It's like the feel-good side of the coin to Joan Didion's truly excellent and exceptionally bleak L.A. classic Play It as It Lays.
picks.name: Brian Stokes

picks.title: Summer of Beer and Whiskey: How Brewers, Barkeeps, Rowdies, Immigrants, and a Wild Pennant Fight Made Baseball America's Game
picks.author: Edward Achorn
picks.text: Take a century-plus trip back in time and see just how much the game in the 19th century resembled (and didn't resemble!) the ol' ballgame we have today! This book also examines one of the most heated pennant races in baseball history: the 1883 American Association battle between the Philadelphia Athletics and St. Louis Browns!
picks.name: Joe Pascullo

picks.title: Super Sushi Ramen Express: One Family's Journey Through the Belly of Japan
picks.author: Michael Booth
picks.text: British writer Michael Booth, takes us along with him, his wife and two young children on a witty, quirky, and utterly charming odyssey across Japan as they explore culinary traditions and trends
picks.name: David Nochimson

picks.title: The Arab of the Future 2
picks.author: Riad Sattouf
picks.text: A graphic memoir and the continuing story of the author's childhood growing up in Syria and France. Filled with the kind of small details that searingly illustrate the larger culture wars and political tribulations through amusing and horrifying stories of family connections, school supply shopping, classroom bullies, and painful adult dreams.
picks.name: Jill Rothstein

picks.title: The Cat King of Havana
picks.author: Tom Crosshill
picks.text: Rick Gutierrez, a teenage New Yorker and cat video mogul, has just lost his mother. He takes up Salsa and meets Ana. The two set out on a trip to Cuba. Political intrigue, coming-of-age drama, and salsa dancing makes this a charming, and engrossing read.
picks.name: Emily Merlino

picks.title: The Fire Next Time
picks.author: James Baldwin
picks.text: So appropriate for the immediate political and social circumstances that are facing our country today that it's scary. Composed of two brilliant short essays, The Fire Next Time manages to highlight and discuss a number of contemporary issues, particularly race relations, but also the intersectionality of things like race, economy, and religion. I'm not the first person to say it: it's as though Baldwin was able to see into the future and write content that would apply to generations to come.
picks.name: Katrina Ortega

picks.title: The Girl With All the Gifts
picks.author: M.R. Carey
picks.text: A chilling tale of humanity's physical and ethical doom. Carey's take on a cordyceps-induced zombie apocalypse explores the desperation of the human survivors and their attempts to find a cure from infected children who, mysteriously, have not succumbed to the mindless hunt for human flesh. Melanie, one of the sentient infected, must journey with protectors willing and unenthusiastic to one of civilization's last bastions.
picks.name: Joshua Soule

picks.title: The Last Duel: A True Story of Crime, Scandal and Trial by Combat in Medieval France
picks.author: Eric Jager
picks.text: The time-worn story of a friendship gone sour spins out in a suspenseful and tragic fashion. A well-researched and tightly written page-turner, it reads as if it could have been written by Walter Scott or Alexandre Dumas, but it's not a novel, it's non-fiction.
picks.name: Christopher Pratt

picks.title: The Loney
picks.author: Andrew Michael Hurley
picks.text: Set on a stretch of desolate coastline in England known as the Loney. This intricately plotted, atmospheric story includes bad weather, ominous occurrences, legends of a local witch, well-drawn characters, and questions of faith. Itâs bleak and creepy and very well written.
picks.name: Lynn Lobash

picks.title: The Long Shadow of Small Ghosts
picks.author: Laura Tillman
picks.text: The story of three brutal murders in a Texas border town. It has a chapter titled, "Don't Read This Before Bed," to give you an idea of how disturbing the crime was -- but the author goes far beyond the grisly details to the larger implications of crime, humanity, the death penalty, and how we handle violence in American society.
picks.name: Gwen Glazer

picks.title: The Mysteries of Udolpho
picks.author: Ann Radcliffe
picks.text: A fantastically detailed Gothic novel about a young heroine trying to escape the treacherous clutches of her guardian while discovering the beautiful mysteries of an Italian castle. The extensive descriptions of the scenery will have you feel that you are really there. This book may be long but it is great fun!
picks.name: Tabrizia Jones

picks.title: The Penalty Area
picks.author: Alain Gillot
picks.text: A soccer coach and his nephew develop a relationship in spite of their tendencies to be alone. The strategy of the game mirrors life and provides a fresh and tender story.
picks.name: Jessica Cline

picks.title: The Rattler
picks.author: Jason McNamara & Greg Hinkle
picks.text: This dark tale of love, crime, and the supernatural will make you think deeply about what measures you would take to find someone you love.
picks.name: Hilda Fournier

picks.title: The Secret History of Twin Peaks
picks.author: Mark Frost
picks.text: Over 200 years of history...and mystery. These collected letters and documents fill in some blanks, answer some questions, and raise many more. It's worth the read, and after 25 years, definitely worth the wait for fans who can finally return to Twin Peaks.
picks.name: Billy Parrott

picks.title: The South Side: A Portrait of Chicago and American Segregation
picks.author: Natalie Moore
picks.text: Journalist and South Side native, Moore, uses the neighborhood to examine segregation, it's history in the South Side, and how it affects the people who live there now. Moore's authenticity and access work hand in hand to paint a vivid and compassionate portrait of a complicated social problem at play among real people.
picks.name: Lynn Lobash

picks.title: Undermajordomo Minor
picks.author: Patrick DeWitt
picks.text: The coming of age tale of Lucy Minor, a rudderless and lazy young man sent off to live in Castle Von Aux as the assistant of the Majordomo. A seemingly harmless and simple job, Lucy takes to his role with ease. But there is danger lurking in the castle and in the town. Quirky, romantic, and at times dark, DeWitt's romp of a story will leave you in tears.
picks.name: Susen Shi

picks.title: We Eat Our Own
picks.author: Kea Wilson
picks.text: Itâs the 1970s and an out of work actor takes a role in a grindhouse film experimenting with âraw, scriptless realismâ and being filmed on location in politically unstable Columbia. The book is based on an actual exploitation film called âCannibal Holocaust.â Think âHearts of Darknessâ and âApocalypse Nowâ, only crazier.
picks.name: Lynn Lobash

picks.title: Welcome to Night Vale
picks.author: Joseph Fink and Jeffrey Cranor
picks.text: An entertaining cocktail of horror, mystery, science-fiction, and sometimes the just plain weird. This novel is not only great for fans of the popular podcast (of the same name), but also for anyone interested in surreal humor, random desert towns, and malevolent librarians.
picks.name: Nanyamkah Mars

picks.title: When Watched: Stories
picks.author: Leopoldine Core
picks.text: A collection of short stories, some sexy and funny, all set in modern day New York City. These are characters on the fringes and the short intimate stories take place in small interiors, mostly apartment and bedrooms. The authorâs style is distinctive, spare and elegant at once. This collection is singular and the author is a talent to watch.
picks.name: Lynn Lobash

picks.title: You Must Change Your Life: The Story of Rainer Maria Rilke and Auguste Rodin
picks.author: Rachel Corbett
picks.text: A chance to be a fly on the wall and witness the intimacy between two creative geniuses. Corbett gives attention to their working spaces, the women in their lives, and the shared influence and barriers of each other's success.
picks.name: Jessica Cline

picks.title: A Beginner's Guide to Bear Spotting
picks.author: Michelle Robinson; Illustrated by David Roberts
picks.text: Learn to charm furry beasts with a simple teddy bear. A humorous how-to.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: All Rise for the Honorable Perry T. Cook
picks.author: Leslie Connor
picks.text: Perry has spent his entire life living in a minimum security prison with his inmate mother.  When he is suddenly forced to live on the "outside," he has to cope with being away from the only family he has ever known.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: As Brave as You
picks.author: Jason Reynolds
picks.text: Two brothers from Brooklyn spend the summer in rural Virginia and discover the complexities of family in this contemporary coming-of-age story.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Beetle Boy
picks.author: M.G. Leonard
picks.text: Will some mutant beetles and three new friends solve the mysterious disappearance of Darkus' father and defeat the creepy, Lucretia Cutter?
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Bunny Slopes
picks.author: Claudia Rueda
picks.text: A bunny is getting ready to ski but needs some help from you in this interactive picture book.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Dragon was Terrible
picks.author: Kelly DiPucchio; Illustrated by Greg Pizzoli
picks.text: When a magical menace terrorizes the people and unicorns of a small kingdom, an unlikely hero steps up.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Duck, Duck, Porcupine!
picks.author: Salina Yoon
picks.text: Who needs goose when you have a friend like porcupine? Little duck's expressions will make you laugh and scream "squee."
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Ghost
picks.author: Jason Reynolds
picks.text: Castle Cranshaw, a.k.a. Ghost, keeps running into trouble until a mentor gets him on the right track.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Giant Squid
picks.author: Candace Fleming; Illustrated by Eric Rohmann
picks.text: With dark and rich illustrations, this lyrical study of Earth's most mysterious creature is equal parts suspenseful and informative.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Haggis and Tank Unleashed : All Paws on Deck
picks.author: Jessica Young; Illustrated by James Burcks
picks.text: Two canine buddies embark on a swashbuckling adventure fuelled only by their imagination.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Hilo: Saving the Whole Wide World
picks.author: Judd Winick
picks.text: After evil sneaks to Earth through a portal created by his big toe, Hilo must stop a robot invasion and face his own destiny.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: I Am a Story
picks.author: Dan Yaccarino
picks.text: Celebrate the power of storytelling and all its various forms.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: I Am Not a Dinosaur
picks.author: Will Lach & The American Museum of Natural History; Illustrated by Jonny Lambert
picks.text: Enter the exciting world of woolly mammoths, dimetrodons and other exquisite creatures. Filled with simple verse and paper-cut art.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: I Am Pan!
picks.author: Mordicai Gerstein
picks.text: A lively look at the mischievous life of the Greek god.  Gerstein's art is as playful as Pan himself.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: If I Had a Gryphon
picks.author: Vikki VanSickle; Illustrated by Cale Atkinson
picks.text: Sam thinks life would be so much more exciting with an exotic, magical creature as a pet. But would it?
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: It Ain't So Awful, Falafel
picks.author: Firoozeh Dumas
picks.text: It's 1979 and Zomorod (Cindy) is trying to fit into her new life in Southern California.  When the hostage crisis hits the headlines, she finds herself explaining all things Iranian, when all she wants to know is how to rock a pom-pom belt and puka shell necklace.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Lily and Dunkin
picks.author: Donna Gephart
picks.text: A young transgender girl and a boy with bipolar disorder both struggling for acceptance, see strength and bravery in each other.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Lucy & Andy Neanderthal
picks.author: Jeffrey Brown
picks.text: This laugh-out-loud prehistoric tale of sibling rivalry and mischief is artfully paired with scientific facts and slapstick comedy.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Moo: A Novel
picks.author: Sharon Creech
picks.text: When Reena and her family unexpectedly move to Maine, they find new friends in an elderly neighbor and a stubborn cow.  Tender story told in verse.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Ms. Bixby's Last Day
picks.author: John David Anderson
picks.text: Three misfits, one very special teacher and a day they'll never forget.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Ooko
picks.author: Esme Shapiro
picks.text: Ooko has a stick, a rock, and a leaf, yet something is missing. Join this quirky fox in his quest to find what he wants most...a friend.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Pax
picks.author: Sara Pennypacker; Illustrated by Jon Klassen
picks.text: Forced apart by the coming of war, a young boy and his fox must each embark on their own epic journey to be reunited. Along the way both must learn to trust new friends and their own instincts for survival.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Pink is for Blobfish: Discovering the World's Perfectly Pink Animals
picks.author: Jess Keating
picks.text: Pretty in pink? Think again! A fun and informative study of the extraordinary rosy-hued creatures that populate our world.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Pugs of the Frozen North (A Not-So Impossible Tale)
picks.author: Philip Reeve; Illustrated by Sarah McIntyre
picks.text: Sika and Shen (and their team of 66 pugs!) want to win the Great Northern Race and meet the Snowfather, who will reward them with their heart's desire.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Red's Planet
picks.author: Eddie Pittman
picks.text: After Red is mistakenly kidnapped by a gang of intergalactic thieves, she finds herself closer to "Paradise" than she could have ever imagined.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: School's First Day of School
picks.author: Adam Rex and Christian Robinson
picks.text: School is suffering from first day jitters.  Luckily, a friendly janitor is there to provide a helping hand.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: The Best Man
picks.author: Richard Peck
picks.text: As Archer navigates middle school, he learns about love, acceptance and the true meaning of friendship. A hilarious tale filled with colorful characters and wacky shenanigans.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: The Bolds
picks.author: Julian Clary; Illustrated by David Roberts
picks.text: There's something different about the new arrivals to the sleepy suburb of Teddington...meet the Bolds.  A fun-filled tale about trying to fit in when you clearly stand out.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: The Girl Who Drank the Moon
picks.author: Kelly Barnhill
picks.text: Can two witches, a swamp monster and a tiny dragon save villagers from an evil council of elders? An engrossing fairy tale of hope, love and family.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: The Great Leopard Rescue: Saving the Amur Leopards
picks.author: Sandra Markle
picks.text: Discover the plans to save the critically endangered Amur leopards and the creation of a dedicated haven for these big cats.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: The Great Pet Escape
picks.author: Victoria Jamieson
picks.text: Join the class pets of Daisy P. Flugelhorn Elementary for a hilarious adventure as they make a break for freedom and save their school along the way.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: The Midnight War of Mateo Martinez
picks.author: Robin Yardi
picks.text: After he catches two skunks stealing his old tricycle, Mateo follows them to "Stink Base." Soon he is caught up in a turf war between the feisty neighborhood critters.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: The Nameless City
picks.author: Faith Erin Hicks; color by Jordie Bellaire
picks.text: Can two friends from different backgrounds bring together a city with a history of never-ending invasions?
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: The Night Gardener
picks.author: Terry Fan and Eric Fan
picks.text: Grimloch Lane is transformed by a mysterious stranger who creates magical topiaries by moonlight and inspires a young boy's imagination.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: The Princess and the Warrior: The Tale of Two Volcanoes
picks.author: Duncan Tonatiuh
picks.text: Illustrations in the style of the Mixtec Codices bring to life an ancient, Aztec love story.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: The Secret Subway
picks.author: Shana Corey; Illustrated by Red Nose Studio
picks.text: Discover New York City's earliest incarnation of the subway system. Told with exquisite stop-motion-esque figures.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: The Wild Robot
picks.author: Peter Brown
picks.text: Shipwrecked on a deserted island, Rozzum: unit 7134, must adapt her factory settings and learn to live in the natural world.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: They All Saw a Cat
picks.author: Brendan Wenzel
picks.text: Follow a feline's journey through the eyes of a fish, a flea and a bee, in this unique exploration of perspective.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Thunder Boy Jr.
picks.author: Sherman Alexie; Illustrated by Yuyi Morales
picks.text: What's in a name?
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Time Traveling with a Hamster
picks.author: Ross Welford
picks.text: If given the chance, would you go back in time to save a loved one?  For Al Chaudhury it almost seems too easy.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Tree: A Peek-Through Picture Book
picks.author: Britta Teckentrup
picks.text: Owl peeks through the foliage as critters frolic through the seasons.  Illustrated with detailed cutouts.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Waylon! One Awesome Thing
picks.author: Sara Pennypacker; Illustrated by Marla Frazee
picks.text: Waylon's world is turned topsy turvy when a classmate splits the fourth grade into cliques. Can science whiz Waylon bring everyone back together?
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Weekends with Max and His Dad
picks.author: Linda Urban; Illustrated by Katie Kath
picks.text: Max and his dad share pizza, pancakes and new adventures when divorce redefines their notion of home.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: When Mischief Came to Town
picks.author: Katrina Nannestad
picks.text: A quiet town is woken up when a quirky, mischievous 10 year old moves in with her strict grandmother.  An irresistible story where the humor flows freely!
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Where Are You Going, Baby Lincoln?
picks.author: Kate DiCamillo; Illustrated by Chris Van Dusen
picks.text: Baby Lincoln braves her sisterâs disapproval by taking the trip of a lifetime.  New friends and jelly beans abound!
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Wolf Hollow
picks.author: Lauren Wolk
picks.text: In a courageous act, Annabelle takes a stand against bullying, injustice and cruelty in 1943 Pennsylvania.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Worm Loves Worm
picks.author: J.J. Austrian; Illustrated by Mike Curato
picks.text: Wave goodbye to convention and rip-up the rule book on wedding etiquette! It's time to toast the newlyweds.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: Yaks Yak: Animal Word Pairs
picks.author: Sue Park; Illustrated by Jennifer Black Reinhardt
picks.text: Wild and witty wordplay abound in this marvelous menagerie.
picks.name: BBFK Committee

picks.title: (Blacktop) Janae & Justin
picks.author: LJ Alonge
picks.text: Sometimes, you can leave it all on the court. Sometimes, you can't.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: A Teen's Guide to the 5 Love Languages
picks.author: Gary Chapman
picks.text: A realistic, easy-to-understand, self-help approach to figuring out love.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: All New X-Men: Inevitable, Vol. 1
picks.author: Dennis Hopeless, Mark Bagley
picks.text: How did a bunch of young mutants become the X-Men? Find out in this new tale of a road trip around the world.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Asking for It
picks.author: Louise O'Neill
picks.text: Emma was a ruthless queen bee at school. But did she deserve what happened to her?
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Being Jazz: My Life as a (Transgender) Teen
picks.author: Jazz Jennings
picks.text: Jazz speaks openly and authentically about what it means to grow up transgender.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Binti
picks.author: Nnedi Okorafor
picks.text: This slender novella is winning every science-fiction award in the book, and rightfully so. It's the story of a girl bound for a university on the other side of the galaxy, far from her home and amid dangers from alien enemies.
picks.name: Gwen Glazer

picks.title: Breakfast with Neruda
picks.author: Laura Moe
picks.text: Station-wagon living isn't all it's cracked up to be -- but Michael's mom is a hoarder, and he doesn't have much of a choice.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Bubonic Panic: When Plague Invaded America
picks.author: Gail Jarrow
picks.text: The true, gruesome history of a deadly plague.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Burn Baby Burn
picks.author: Meg Medina
picks.text: Nora's just trying to survive the sweltering Queens summer of 1977. But it's tough with a violent brother, a city-wide blackout, and a serial killer on the loose.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Exit, Pursued by a Bear
picks.author: E.K. Johnston
picks.text: Hermione is strong, confident, and ready to take on the world. But after she's raped, her life turns upside down.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Feminism: Reinventing the F-Word
picks.author: Nadia Abushanab Higgins
picks.text: What does it mean to be a feminist? Learn about women who've rocked that label, from Susan B. to Laverne Cox.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Girl in Pieces
picks.author: Kathleen Glasgow
picks.text: Cutting used to make the pain go away, but now Charlotte must learn to live with her scars.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Girl in the Blue Coat
picks.author: Monica Hesse
picks.text: Hanneke knows how to find things in 1943 Amsterdam. But when a client asks her to locate a hidden Jewish girl, her greatest -- and most dangerous -- search yet is about to begin.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Goldie Vance, Vol. 1
picks.author: Hope Larson, Brittney Williams
picks.text: We imagine Goldie as Nancy Drew's way cooler daughter. Stolen necklaces and international espionage? She's on the case.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: How to Hang a Witch
picks.author: Adriana Mather
picks.text: The Salem witch trials meet "Mean Girls."
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: I Hate Fairyland, Vol. 1
picks.author: Skottie Young
picks.text: What happens when a kid gets her wish to live in Fairyland forever... and ever... and ever... and is then stuck there as a middle-aged woman? This graphic novel sports exceedingly graphic but candy-colored violence, which plucks a strange emotional string that's still vibrating long after the last page. Definitely for adults.
picks.name: Gwen Glazer

picks.title: If I Was Your Girl
picks.author: Meredith Russo
picks.text: Amanda just moved to a rural Southern town. Sheâs finding her way with a new identity, a new school, and, just maybe, a new boyfriend.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Iron Cast
picks.author: Destiny Soria
picks.text: Ada and Corinne are creators of illusions, allergic to iron, and outcasts in 1919 Boston â all while staying one step ahead of the authorities.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Keep Me in Mind
picks.author: Jaime Reed
picks.text: Two years lost; no memory of their love. Can Liam help Ellia remember?
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Kuroko's Basketball, Vol. 1
picks.author: Tadatoshi Fujimaki
picks.text: Mild-mannered Tetsuya Kuroko doesn't usually stand out, but now that he's taking on his former teammates, it's his time to shine.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Labyrinth Lost
picks.author: Zoraida CÃ³rdova
picks.text: Alex is an encantrix, a Brooklyn bruja with ultimate powers. A regrettable mistake, a dangerous journey through the underworld, a power reborn.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Lucky Boy
picks.author: Shanthi Sekaran
picks.text: Two interconnected stories about family and immigration that intersect at the point of a single little boy. (Decide for yourself whether he's lucky.) Heartbreaking, beautiful, really makes you think. Literary fiction fans: Don't miss this one.
picks.name: Gwen Glazer

picks.title: Lumberjanes, Vols. 3 & 4
picks.author: Shannon Watters, Noelle Stevenson
picks.text: Best Books for Teens or THE BEST BOOKS EVER?! Our all-time favorite campers embark on new adventures with yetis, blizzards, and so much more.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: March: Book Three
picks.author: John Lewis, Andrew Aydin, and Nate Powell
picks.text: Framed by Obama's inauguration, this graphic novel is the final installment in the trilogy tracing the Civil Rights movement. Pick it up and get inspired.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Monstress, Vol. 1: Awakening
picks.author: Marjorie Liu
picks.text: When a brutal war nearly decimates the world and leaves it on the brink of more conflict, Maika Halfwolf must trek through dangerous grounds to discover her heritage while controlling the monster within.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Ms. Marvel, Vol. 5: Super Famous
picks.author: G. Willow Wilson
picks.text: Fighting bad guys, attending family weddings, doing homework... Kamala tries to do it all, with the help of some clones.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Never Missing, Never Found
picks.author: Amanda Panitch
picks.text: Itâs better to be missing than dead. When youâre dead, you canât escape.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: orange: The Complete Collection, Vol. 1
picks.author: Ichigo Takano
picks.text: When Naho receives a letter from her future self, she has to decide whether she's willing to change the past.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Outrun the Moon
picks.author: Stacey Lee
picks.text: Nothing will stand in the way of Mercy Wong's dreams, except maybe the San Francisco earthquake of 1906.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Princess Jellyfish, Vol. 1
picks.author: Akiko Higashimura
picks.text: A sweet manga about a group of offbeat fangirls finding their tribe of like-minded friends. Perfect for anyone who's ever felt like an outsider.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Rani Patel in Full Effect
picks.author: Sonia Patel
picks.text: "Call my solution a female revolution retribution in the form of rhyme electrocution." MC Sutra in the house.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Riding Chance
picks.author: Christine Kendall
picks.text: Troy is a city kid who's never even seen a horse, let alone played polo. But a Chance meeting changes everything.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Sachiko: A Nagasaki Bomb Survivor's Story
picks.author: Caren Stelson
picks.text: Sachiko was six years old when her world exploded. This is the story about the fallout of the atomic bomb, told through the eyes of a child.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Salt to the Sea
picks.author: Ruta Sepetys
picks.text: East Prussia, 1945. Four teens and one ill-fated voyage. Everyone is just trying to survive.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Samurai Rising: The Epic Life of Minamoto Yoshitsune
picks.author: Pamela S. Turner, Gareth Hinds
picks.text: Violence, action, revenge... the epic history of a samurai legend.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Shallow Graves
picks.author: Kali Wallace
picks.text: Breezy is trapped between life and death.  Will she follow a path of revenge?
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Silver Surfer, Vol. 3: Last Days
picks.author: Dan Slott, Michael Allred
picks.text: Norrin Radd, Dawn, and Toomie go on a quirky, cosmic, existential adventure.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Spontaneous
picks.author: Aaron Starmer
picks.text: When Katelyn Ogden explodes in the middle of pre-calc, Mara knows her senior year is going to be like no other. A dark, funny, oddly moving satire.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Star Wars: Vader Down
picks.author: Jason Aaron, Mike Deodato
picks.text: Vader has always seemed to stick to the dark side, but there's more to the man behind the mask...
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Tetris: The Games People Play
picks.author: Box Brown
picks.text: The world's most addictive video game is now the world's most addictive book!
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: The Call
picks.author: Peadar Ã GuilÃ­n
picks.text: Three minutes and four seconds. Three minutes and four seconds to stay alive. Three minutes and four seconds to escape the SÃ­dhe, a race of ancient Irish fairies out for blood.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: The Haters
picks.author: Jesse Andrews
picks.text: Out of the ashes of jazz camp, a band is formed! Now, Wes, Corey, and Ash are on the road in search of a gig that doesnât suck.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: The Head of the Saint
picks.author: Socorro Acioli
picks.text: Samuel lives in the head of a fallen statue. He starts answering people's prayers while waiting for his own miracle.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: The Passion of Dolssa
picks.author: Julie Berry
picks.text: Two girls in medieval France try to outsmart the Catholic Church as it searches for heretics to burn at the stake.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: The Smell of Other People's Houses
picks.author: Bonnie-Sue Hitchcock
picks.text: Ruth, Dora, Alyce, and Hank navigate the wilds of 1970s Alaska, and their interweaving stories reveal the meaning of home.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: The Sun Is Also a Star
picks.author: Nicola Yoon
picks.text: Natasha and Daniel have a chance meeting on the streets of NYC. As their lives intersect, they find that even in a city of strangers, weâre all connected.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: The V-Word: True Stories about First-Time Sex
picks.author: Amber J. Keyser
picks.text: Sexy, awkward, frightening, silly... everyone's first time is different. A beautiful collection of consensual experiences from 17 women writers.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: The Weight of Zero
picks.author: Karen Fortunati
picks.text: Cath has bipolar disorder. Her bucket list might just save her life.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Three Dark Crowns
picks.author: Kendare Blake
picks.text: Three queens, three powers, one crown. The showdown of a generation.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Up from the Sea
picks.author: Leza Lowitz
picks.text: After the Japanese tsunami, Kai learns the universal language of loss, grief, and hope.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: We Are the Ants
picks.author: Shaun David Hutchinson
picks.text: If aliens gave you a chance to save the world, would you?
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Where Futures End
picks.author: Parker Peevyhouse
picks.text: Looking into this dystopian world, we see the connections that can hold us together -- and the threat that can tear the future down.
picks.name: BBFT Committee

picks.title: Women of Colonial America: 13 Stories of Courage and Survival in the New World
picks.author: Brandon Marie Miller
picks.text: Move over, Founding Fathers! Explore the lives and little-known stories of the women who helped shape America.
picks.name: BBFT Committee
